result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Mitchel Longsdorf

defendant.name: Longsdorf, Todd Mitchel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of count 1 of 14CF30/max penalties and advises of count 1 in 15CF07/max. penalties; advises defendant of his constitutional rights, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to Count 1 in 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07.    Plea colloquy. Judge again advises defendant of his rights; court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas in Count 1 of 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07 and finds defendant guilty.  DRI counts 2-8 in 14CF30, DRI 15CM25, DRI 15TR38, 15TR97, Order PSI.  Trial cancelled.  Any conditions of bond are continued.  See scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties close to resolution, suggest 1 more status conference.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Status conference at 11-16-2015 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 12-07-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter to be set for STC to track with JT in 14CF30.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charge/max. penalties and rights.  NGP entered.  Counsel to schedule matter for STC at the same time as arraignment in felony case.
